How often don‚Äôt we say: ‚ÄòAsk nature‚Äô or ‚ÄòLook at nature‚Äô when dealing with complexity? But how often do we actually DO that? Asking nature? üé§ How can biomimicry, the practice that learns from and mimics the strategies found in nature, help solve human design challenges?For answers to these questions, and for raising more questions, Carola and Marco did not ask nature, but they asked Hugo Araujo. In this second episode of the 21for21 series, Carola Verschoor and Marco Van Hout talk to Hugo Araujo from 7Vortex about biomimicry in the context of transformation. https://buff.ly/3dzjaK2

Is the pandemic functioning as a contrast fluid, showing us what real transformation (external and internal) can do?How can we really embody change (as individuals, as organisations) and stop to just think about possible futures?In our first episode of the 21for21 series, Carola and Marco talk to Wouter van Noort about personal development in the context of transformation.In the fascinating and rich conversation that follows, Wouter addresses several topics such as consciousness, systems change, the role of the self in transformation, the future-now concept and how it is time for internalisation.Wouter van Noort is a Dutch journalist who explores our potential futures and systems change, and recently started a weekly newsletter Transcend, about transcendental purpose and meaning. He works for the daily newspaper NRC Handelsblad and is a commentator for several tv and radio programs. Wouter founded Future Affairs, a fast growing digital subdomain of NRC with a podcast, a weekly curated newsletter, an online community and live events.LINK to episode in comments Dear Future I'm Ready is a collaboration between Digital Society School and Transformational.Studio

The EdTech for Social Change track uses technology to boost individual learning, corporate training and to make learning accessible to vulnerable social groups.In 2020 the Hogeschool van Amsterdam University of Applied Science, the Gemeente Amsterdam StartupAmsterdam the Metropolitan Office of Amsterdam and the Amsterdam Economic Board joined forceer with us. The aspiration was to bring key players together to leverage talent development in an effective way; the Talent Ecosystem Guide (TEG) was born.Now the team of Dimitrios Vlachopoulos, PhD, SFHEA, FRSA , Mari Luz Garcia AZUSA MATSUKUBO , Alexandros Sapounidis Mariam Hatem, Esm√©e van der Knaap and Nithin David Wilson to find out how to attract companies in using TEG. Many new projects are starting right now, so it‚Äôs time to introduce them to you. Let's kick off with EIPSI, which stands for Evidence Informed Practice for School Inclusion approach on which Dimitrios Vlachopoulos, PhD, SFHEA, FRSA, Asia Trzeciak, Panna Chow, Carolin Henze, Kyra Kronenberg, Vincent Z. and Charvi Mantri are working.Socio-economic status is one of the strongest determinants of students‚Äô academic performance. In order to Link for the project on our website to get more information see comment.overcome these inequalities and promote inclusion schools need to adopt educational measures. The team‚Äôs aim is to encourage and motivate teachers to use scientific evidence when making decisions to improve students' learning. ‚ÄúWe hope to contribute to reducing the gap between advantaged and disadvantaged pupils and promoting inclusion at schools‚Äù.Link for the project on our website to get more information see comment.

Job alert!  We are still looking for an experienced Online Marketeer with a passion for digital transformation and who wants to have a positive impact on society. Gaspard Bos calls himself a transition (because sustainability is dead) designer and, under the guise of New State of Matter (NSOMa), provides "relationship therapy for people and things.‚Äù His way of therapy is to reify the value of data to make products more meaningful and improve the lives of their users.At the same time he has a firm belief in using design methods on a political level to challenge our current market-logic. Since 2010 all his projects have a global problems focus and his latest interest is on how to transition from centrally controlled and shareholder owned social platforms to cooperatively shared and governed social networks.Has been setting up and running projects with many different collaborators and stakeholders, prototyping plastic recycling machines as well as machine learning models, and teaching design at TU Delft and the Wilem de Kooning academy and now also at the Digital Society School.Next to that he plays the ukulele and surfs and is learning the Bosnian language to be able to chit chat with his mother-in-law.

We are very excited for our panel session at #sxsw2021 #sxswedu tonight. Join our own Marco Van Hout, Frank Uffen (The Student Hotel) and Sabine de Zeeuw (Growth Tribe) in a conversation on going "beyond blended":How can we organise international learning experiences, with on- and off campus interaction and learning, and make sure they are truly connected? In this session emerging practices from Europe will be shared and illustrated with three cases: TSH a campus network open to education brands, Digital Society School offering transformational learning for a responsible, digital and global mindset and GrowthTribe creating a lifelong learn community with and for upskilled digital professionals.To join click on the link in the comments.

Our Global Goals Jam partner in Hong Kong, FabCafe Global HK, is calling entries to design a better world and our very own Anneke van Woerden is part of the jury!If you are working on innovative projects, or you have creative ideas which aims to build a better world, this is the chance to show your incredible works! The submission deadline has extended to 21 Mar 2021. Winning entries will be exhibited at FabCafe HK with money prize! Submit your work today! (and let us know that you did, so we can look forward to judging your entry - as we are part of the expert jury!) About the Better World Challenge:he Better World Challenge is a design competition challenging innovators, entrepreneurs, designers and students to explore creative and original ideas for a sustainable future. The purpose of the competition is to inspire creativity and collaboration through community-driven innovation.The Better World Challenge is organized by FabCafe Hong Kong and supported by Design Trust. Read more and apply here: https://buff.ly/3vf7cfr

Meet Anna. She is the Digital Transformation Designer of the Design Across Cultures track, has a background in anthropology, was involved in the Jeroen Pithuis project and is now working the project ‚ÄúDesigning for Culturally Inclusive Mental Health‚Äù.She is fascinated by the ways in which human beings produce, communicate and maintain certain 'ways of knowing' - through dialogue as well as through an infrastructure of digital and non-digital artifacts. In other words, what ensures that some people's world views are taken for granted, while other‚Äôs views are neglected or altogether invisible - and how does this influence the process of designing new digital tools? She truly believes such questions are essential to consider in pursuing more ethical digital development.

What??? Yes, we are actually going to create a digital twin of a paralympic sporter from the Topsport Academie HvA through the technology of StreamingBuzz (Aionsports).The team that consists of Shauna Jin Mariana Pinheiro Alexander Bernevega , Elisa Cocchi , Mark√©ta Davidov√° Gaspard Bos Valentina Mari√±o are going to explore how to support top sporters with data driven insights to balance their sporting career, life, and work/study with technology around existing and innovative channels including AR and VR. Cool right?For more information go to the link in our comments.

Connection doesn't just happen, you have to design for it! Last week on Monday we welcomed our newest batch of Trainees for our Digital Transformation Intensive Program. Rather than diving straight into the work, we make space to build up the learning community. This means that our trainees are more comfortable asking the hard questions when they start to explore complex challenges later on. Judging on how they described their mood as they left the first day, I think we can say that with the right facilitation it is possible to start building connections online!

What is Implicit Bias? Implicit bias refers to attitudes or stereotypes that affect our understanding, actions, and decisions in an unconscious manner. It can result in actions and outcomes that do not necessarily align with explicit intentions of the person. Many times, those with implicit biases, hold no explicit biases.Interested to learn more? Register here for the course Diversity and Inclusion: https://buff.ly/3psVLNe

She has experience designing for IoT in the toy, therapy, and healthcare industries, has taught in academia, and has worked with the retail industries to help accelerate the sustainable shift. She has now joined DSS as a Digital Transformation Designer for the Digital Twins track where she is excited to explore the possibilities around data analysis in developing a sustainable and accessible future.

Do you know what Digital Twin is? A Digital Twin is a virtual representation of an object, a person or a process. The concept of Digital Twin is not new, but the application of Artificial Intelligence might turn it into a truly disruptive technology.What happens when digital twins are linked to the real world, real people, real processes?Who will be using this technology and for what purposes?Will we be in control, or will digital twins control us?How do we interact with digital twins?On Tursday October 29th, Digital Society School will host a Digital Twin Webinar, where you can learn about the current and future application of Digital Twin from artists, philosophers, designers, technologists and innovators.Together we will explore how it will impact our lives,we will debate about the ethical implicationsand paint a picture of the future of our digital society.

Join us, DEC 8, 14:00-15:00 CET, in this free online talk by Grace Kwon on "Community Design"COMMUNITY DESIGNCitizen participation as design methodology Design Thinking is useless if we don‚Äôt understand the history or implications of its predecessor ‚Äì Community Design. How can design become a practice of facilitation and care rather than a performance of power and hierarchy? How might design methodologies change and heal societies? Through this talk Grace shares stories of why we need to reassess and redesign Design Thinking to elevate design as a communal effort in solving for the most complex challenges our future brings.

Since the pandemic started the way we offer education and the way we learn has very much been disrupted. Teachers around the world had to move classical teaching online overnight. But online teaching is more than just transferring presentations to a digital platform. How do you ensure effectiveness of the education, and how can you ensure engagement of the students?Our expert Dimitrios Vlachopoulos, PhD, SFHEA, FRSA has carefully created a series of modules to help you navigate this world of online education and learning, and empower teachers to thrive in the new way of education.Check out the link to our courses here: https://lnkd.in/dz5XDaF
